moves.1. e4 e5 2. Bc4 f5: Uncle Alonzo wants to test his nephew's mettle. A very aggressive move with the Black pieces.
moves.3. exf5 Nf6: To prevent a future Q-R5 ch.
moves.4. Nc3 d5 5. Nxd5: The younger Morphy offers a piece [5... NxN 6 BxN QxB] in return for the second Pawn. Daringly played.
moves.5... Bc5 6. Nxf6+ Qxf6: After his uncle declines the sacrifice, Paul consolidates his material advantge.
moves.7. d3 Bxf5: Winning back one of the Pawns.
moves.10... Nd7 11. O-O h6 12. c3 O-O-O: With both men having castled, the opening is complete and the middle-game begins.
moves.13. b4 Bb6 14. a4: Paul seeks Q-side play to counter his uncle's K-side pressure. Both men are going after the location of the other player's King.
moves.14... a6 15. Qb3 Bxf3: With the Knight no longer pinned, Alonzo sees no reason not to exchange.
moves.16. Bxf3 g5 17. Be3 g4: An oversight, perhaps. Paul gratefully captures the loose Pawn.
moves.18. Bxg4 Bc7 19. Bf3 Rhg8 20. Be4 Rg4 21: Paul's 2 extra Pawns will be a bigger advantage with every piece exchange.
moves.22. b5 axb5 23. axb5: The QR becomes an active piece without having budged from its home square.
moves.23... Nb6 24. bxc6 Rdg8: Alonzo ignores his nephew's correlation of forces and presses his own attack. Down 3 Pawns, he has little choice.
moves.25. Rf2 Qd8 26. Ra8+: 26... NxR??? is impossible because of 27 QxP mate. So...
moves.26... Bb8 27. Bxb6: With his huge material deficit, Alonzo could resign now. But he plays a few more moves, hoping his nephew will blunder away the win.
moves.30. Kh1 Qc1+ 31. Bg1: Alonzo throws in the towel. Well played by Paul.
